alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 1:54AM CDT until June 29 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR WESTERN RED WILLOW AND HITCHCOCK COUNTIES... At 151 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Trenton, moving east at 25 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM for CULBERTSON and MCCOOK. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...This storm has a history of producing ping pong ball to baseball size hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Culbertson and McCook. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
